meanings.definition: To make or become soft or tender by cooking
meanings.sent1: After intenerating the vegetables in the soup, they were easy to chew.
meanings.sent2: She intenerated the butter by leaving it out of the fridge.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally intenerated the pasta, turning it into mush.
meanings.sent4: The sun intenerated the snow, turning it into slush.
meanings.sent5: The warmth of the oven intenerated the cheese, making it gooey and delicious.

meanings.definition: To soften or dissolve by heat or moisture
meanings.sent1: The rain intenerated the sugar cubes left outside.
meanings.sent2: He intenerated the soap in warm water before using it.
meanings.sent3: The hot tea intenerated the sugar cube in seconds.
meanings.sent4: The heat intenerated the ice, turning it into water.
meanings.sent5: The steam intenerated the chocolate, making it melt smoothly.
